page.title: 16MARATHON RUNNING FOR FUNDS
page.content: I watched the{London Marathon}on television on Sunday 21st April 1985. I was looking for my Dad, he was number 193.{17,500}people entered the 26 mile race and{16,000}finished the course and received a medal from the organisers, Mars Confectionary Ltd. My Dad's time was 2 hours 31 minutes and 10 seconds. He was running to raise money for our school. We needed{Â£265}to pay our share of the cost of installing 2{sink {units,}with hot and cold water, for classrooms 1 and 2. Everyone in school sponsored him and altogether he raised {Â£664.71.}We are going to buy{musical {instruments}- descant recorders, chime-bars and glockenspeils with the extra money. We should also have enough money left to buy another {computer.
